s.text: This is the room, Bode told viewers, where Churchill planned the strategy that won the war, the room where Europe's fleeing crowned heads found refuge.

The floor in Margaret Truman's room had actually broken under the weight of her piano, and Harry Truman himself was directed to sleep in the comparatively sound Lincoln Bedroom (if indeed it was Lincoln's bedroom; he may have used it only as a study), lest he find himself one morning in the Red Room downstairs.
Abe's spirit has been pretty quiet since the midcentury restoration.
Abe's spirit has been pretty quiet since the midcentury restoration.
Abe's spirit has been pretty quiet since the midcentury restoration.

Ken Bode, moderator of PBS' journalists round-table, Washington Week in Review , spelled out the case for defilement right after the story broke that big-time campaign money would get you booked overnight with Honest Abe.
